CV

General Information

Full Name Dipesh Pandey
Date of Birth 19th February 1996
Languages English, Nepali, Norwegian

Experience

  • 2022 - Present
    Tech Manager / Volunteer
    Studentradioen i Oslo - Radionova
    • Working on platform development to ensure 24/7 availability of one of the biggest student run radio stations in Norway.
    • My day-to-day tasks involve bug fixing, creating open-source tools for interfacing physical radio tools with the on-premise servers.
    • I am also responsible for mentoring tech enthusiasts and students.
  • 2022 - Present
    Software Engineer
    Retriever AS
    • Working on building data pipelines to manage data from several clients across the Nordics.
    • I am primarily responsible for working in both the infrastructure team as well as the backend team to build and test internal packages, and APIs.
  • 2021 - 2022
    Software Engineer (Contract)
    Insolution
    • Worked as the sole backend developer to build a crypto taxation platform for users in Austria, Germany, and Switzerland.
    • I was responsible for building the API, documentation, testing, CI/CD, meeting with stakeholders, and collaborating with frontend developers.
  • 2019 - 2020
    Developer (Remote)
    Teamcoda
    • In a team of professional freelancers from the Netherlands, I worked as a developer to help clients build their MVPs.
    • I worked as a backend developer with some frontend work, primarily focused on API development, web crawling, and SPA development.
  • 2018 - 2019
    Developer
    Converzion
    • Worked on a patented technology to design and deploy the API for the core product of the company.
    • Contributed as a developer for a real-time CMS for the few biggest clients in the world.
    • Worked on collection and transformation of data from few of the biggest clients in APAC.
    • Lead a remote development team based in Nepal and coordinated with the team in Singapore.

Education

  • 2022
    Masters
    Norwegian University of Science and Technology, Gjøvik, Norway
    • The masters focused on analyzing the Ethereum blockchain, especially Uniswap, to identify the trends and patterns on how token pairs are traded and understand the degree of decentralization of these exchange platforms
    • I also worked as a research assistant in Database management course to help grade assignments as well as guide students
    • Took courses and built projects in various fields like Deeplearning, NLP, and Full-Stack Web Development

Academic Interests

    • Entanglement

Other Interests
